name: Bitwarden
desc: A secure and free password manager for all of your devices

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: The domain the Bitwarden/Vaultwarden is accessible on.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Whether to sync ldap groups into BitWarden.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Whether to enable Bitwarden Directory Connector.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: The bitwarden-directory-connector-cli package to use.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Remove users from bitwarden groups if no longer in the ldapgroup.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Options to configure the LDAP connection. If you used the desktopapplication to test the configuration you can find the settings bysearching for ldap in~/.config/Bitwarden\ Directory\ Connector/data.json.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Options to configure what gets synced. If you used the desktopapplication to test the configuration you can find the settings bysearching for sync in~/.config/Bitwarden\ Directory\ Connector/data.json.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: User to run the program.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Sync users.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: User directory, relative to root.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Class that users must have.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: LDAP filter for users.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Attribute for a users email.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: If a user has no email address, combine a username prefix with asuffix value to form an email.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Remove and re-add users/groups, See https://bitwarden.com/help/user-group-filters/#overwriting-syncsfor more details.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Attribute that lists members in a LDAP group.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Enable if you are syncing more than 2000 users/groups.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Group directory, relative to root.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: A class that groups will have.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Attribute for a name of group.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: LDAP filter for groups.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Suffix for the email, normally @example.com.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: The attribute that contains the users username.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Attribute that lists a user’s creation date.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Path to file that contains LDAP password for user in{option}`ldap.username

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Path to file that contains Client Secret.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Path to file that contains Client ID.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: The user to authenticate as.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Whether to use STARTTLS.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Whether to use TLS.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Root path for LDAP.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Port LDAP is accessible on.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Whether the LDAP server paginates search results.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: The host the LDAP is accessible on.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: Whether the LDAP Server is an Active Directory.

options.name: security/bitwarden-directory-connector-cli.nix
options.desc: The interval when to run the connector. This uses systemd’sOnCalendar syntax.
